intro: Draba aizoon, commonly known as the Sierra glaucous whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in open, sunny areas. Its leaves are basal, linear, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba aizoon is adapted to harsh conditions, showcasing resilience through its compact growth form and efficient water use.
